DOC.brief_summary: There two option fetal treatment case severe low urinary tract obstruction : vesico-amniotic shunt fetal cystoscopy . There study confirm effectiveness treatment , specially compare technique . The present study aim investigate effectiveness treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Fetal Cystoscopy Versus Vesico-amniotic Shunting Severe Lower Urinary Tract Obstructions
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : To evaluate effectiveness fetal cystoscopy diagnosis therapy posterior urethral valve compare result vesicoamniotic shunting . Outcomes : Accuracy prenatal cystoscopic diagnosis posterior urethral valve , neonatal infant survival ( 6 12 month ) , well normal renal function age . Study design : Randomized controlled trial . Methods : Pregnant woman whose fetus isolate severe low urinary tract obstruction ( LUTO ) ( oligohydramnios severe hydronephrosis ) invite participate present study . Patients randomize fetal cystoscopic group ( CYSTO ) vs vesico-amniotic shunting ( VAS ) . The investigator intend enroll 30 patient group ( total 60 ) . All patient follow fetal ultrasound 15 day . Besides , infants follow one year age . Maternal obstetrical complication go evaluate well neonatal infant survival renal function .
DOC.criteria: single pregnancy male fetuses gestational age date ultrasound examination perform 20 week confirm severe LUTO ( see detail ) severe oligohydramnios ( AFI < 5.0cm ) structural anomaly complete fetal anatomy ultrasound scan fetal echocardiogram abnormal karyotype 'favorable ' urine analysis ( urinary sodium < 100 mEq/L , chloride < 90 mEq/L , osmolarity < 200 mOsm/L ) gestational age > 20 week presence anomaly diagnose fetal intervention maternal refusal participate present protocol
